intro: Polyosma rigidiuscula, commonly known as the rigid leaved polyosma, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforests or understorey habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
